rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This is a single Specialty Bunny. Players that have three or more down may play two cards per turn.

title: Bunnies Of Hazzard - Double Specialty Bunny

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This is a double Specialty Bunny. Players that have three or more down may play two cards per turn.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This is a triple Specialty Bunny. The player with these bunnies down may play two cards per turn.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: This is a triple Specialty Bunny. The player with these bunnies down may play two cards per turn.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to choose a Carrot from Kaballa's Market. When all the carrots are taken from Kaballa's Market the game is over and The Magic Carrot is revealed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to choose a Carrot from Kaballa's Market. When all the carrots are taken from Kaballa's Market the game is over and The Magic Carrot is revealed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to choose two Carrots from Kaballa's Market. When all the carrots are taken from Kaballa's Market the game is over and The Magic Carrot is revealed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to choose three Carrots from Kaballa's Market. When all the carrots are taken from Kaballa's Market the game is over and The Magic Carrot is revealed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must feed the amounts shown by the end of its next turn or die.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must feed the amounts shown by the end of its next turn or die.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any Bunny which must feed the amounts rolled by the end of its next turn or die.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 13 to survive. If the opponent's bunny survives then the weapon returns to one of the player's bunnies (and back and forth) until either the opponent's or the player's bunny dies.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 14 to survive.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 15 to survive.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 16 to survive.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 17 to escape. A bunny in a C.O.M.A. cannot play any aggressive cards (sinct it is unconscious) but may be used to win the game (since it is still alive).

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: Red and Pink bunnies in a C.O.M.A. still have their special feature active.

rules.title: Sunny Day
rules.text: Sunny Day can be used to awake a bunny from a C.O.M.A.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: A player must put two bunnies into the Hornet to use this weapon. Hornet moves around The Bunny Circle counter-clockwise and attacks one bunny per player every round. An opponent must roll higher than 18 to survive. If an opponent survives then the Hornet is destroyed. The bunnies are returned and the weapon is discarded when the Hornet returns to the player.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text:
Double Free Agents, Specialty Bunny (double or triplet) and Celebrity Bunny (double or triplet) may be used in the Hornet, however, each counts as a single bunny. While these bunnies are away, a player may not use any Aggressive cards unless he has other bunnies in The Bunny Circle. The Hornet visits the first player counter-clockwise (that has at least one bunny in The Bunny Circle) and attacks one of his bunnies. The Hornet continues visiting only players with bunnies in a counter-clockwise direction and only attacks one bunny per player before moving on to the next player.

If any opponent rolls higher than 18 on the Clear 20-sided die, then the Hornet and the bunnies are destroyed. If an opponent survives the attack by using Defense Cards, then the Hornet and the bunnies are not destroyed.

If the Hornet makes it back to the player who initially launched it, then the weapon is discarded and the bunnies are returned to The Bunny Circle. Barriers placed after the launch of the Hornet may prevent it from ever returning to the original player.

If the Hornet has no viable bunny targets left in The Bunny Circle or if the Hornet is confined to an area of The Bunny Circle by two or more Barriers and cannot reach a viable bunny target on the other side, then the Hornet is removed (discarded) and the bunnies are returned to the player and placed in The Bunny Circle. Just like all Roaming Red Run cards, if the Hornet hits a Barrier, it will reverse direction and may affect the same player's bunnies on two consecutive turns.

rules.title: Anti-Missile
rules.text: The Anti-Missile can be used to eliminate the F-18 Hornet.

rules.title: Bad Mood Ood
rules.text: Bad Mood Ood may be used to eliminate this card.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 19 to survive.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be paced on any bunny which dies immediately. Plutonium remains in The Bunny Circle. Adjacent bunnies to the Plutonium die for two more rounds as it becomes the player's turn again. Clover bunnies may survive.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: If a bunny does survive (using Clover or Defense), it will have to roll or defend again on the next turn.

rules.title: Albino Baby 5000
rules.text: The Albino Baby 5000 can be used to protect bunnies from Plutonium Radiation.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Returns Kaballa's Market, Rooney's Weapons Emporium & Weil's Pawn Shop to their original Starter Cards.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used by a player as any two bunnies of any color (except Red or Pink) If one bunny dies, then they both die.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: Double Free Agent bunnies may be used by a player as any two bunnies of any two kinds (Congenial, Gleeful, Lumbering, Sinister or Timid) and of any two colors (except Red or Pink). The identity of the two bunnies may be the same or different bunnies. The identity of the two bunnies may change at any time during play as the need arises. Double Free Agent bunnies make forming a Bunny Triplet much easier. A Double Free Agent must be treated as a single target when hit with a weapon or Feed The Bunny card. Double Free Agent bunnies cannot become Specialty bunnies or Celebrity bunnies

rules.title: Cloning
rules.text: This bunny cannot be Cloned

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used by a player as any two bunnies of any color (except Red or Pink) If one bunny dies, then they both die.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: Double Free Agent bunnies may be used by a player as any two bunnies of any two kinds (Congenial, Gleeful, Lumbering, Sinister or Timid) and of any two colors (except Red or Pink). The identity of the two bunnies may be the same or different bunnies. The identity of the two bunnies may change at any time during play as the need arises. Double Free Agent bunnies make forming a Bunny Triplet much easier. A Double Free Agent must be treated as a single target when hit with a weapon or Feed The Bunny card. Double Free Agent bunnies cannot become Specialty bunnies or Celebrity bunnies

rules.title: Cloning
rules.text: This bunny cannot be Cloned

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny. Heptdruple Lucky Clover lowers the strength of any weapon by seven.

rules.title: Miracle Growth
rules.text: Miracle Growth can be used to double the amount of clover

rules.title: Black Cat
rules.text: The Black Cat can remove clover modifiers from a bunny.

rules.title: 50/50 Weapons
rules.text: 50/50 Weapons are not affected by clover modifiers.

rules.title: Gender Weapons
rules.text: Gender Weapons are not affected by clover modifiers.

rules.title: Abduction
rules.text: Clover modifiers are discarded when a bunny is abducted by Area 51 or the Mothership.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: The alien Mother abducts all of the bunnies of a single player. All bunnies are returned when another single bunny is taken using Area 51.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text:
If an abducted bunny has any Bunny Modifier cards (such as Clover or the Containment Suit), or a pending card (such as a Feed The Bunny card, The Trojan Bunny or The Ebola Virus), then those cards are immediately discarded.

If the bunny that is abducted has Cyber Bunny on top of it, then the bunny goes away with the Beyea Aliens and Cyber Bunny moves on to the next viable bunny target in The Bunny Circle.

A player with an abducted bunny and no other bunny in The Bunny Circle may not play any Aggressive cards (cards that have a Pink rectangular box) or a Choose A Carrot card. An abducted bunny cannot count towards a Bunny Triplet because it is not in The Bunny Circle. At the end of the game, a player with only an abducted bunny may still win the game (since the bunny is still alive).

rules.title: Hitchbunny's Guide
rules.text: Hitchbunny's Guide can be used to retrieve this card from the discard pile because it contains a picture of the planet Jupiter.

rules.title: Bunnies In Black
rules.text: Bunnies In Black can be used to protect a player's bunnies from abduction, or used to return all abducted bunnies.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: The color of the highest roll is the Pawn that the player may pilfer from any opponent or Weil.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: The player may take the Pawn from Weil even if the shop is closed. If two or more dice roll the highest number, then the player may pilfer more than one Pawn.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text:
Market is open with New Prices:
1 Dolla - for each Defense Card
1/2 Level - for each Weapon Card
(Weapons may be used immediately)

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Forces all players (except the one playing the card) to turn their Run cards face up. After these cards cycle through then new Run cards are played face down again.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text:
If all dice show different numbers then the player receives 1 Carrot and 10 Dolla. If any two dice show the same number (doubles) then one of your bunnies gets snuffed by the Casino bosses.

Optional Gamble: Roll the Red die. If no doubles appear then receive another 10 Dolla and receive two bunnies from the discard pile. If doubles is rolled then all bunnies, Carrots and Dolla are taken

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text:
The player may only take the Carrot if Kaballa's Market is open, but if he loses his Carrots in the optional gamble, they must be returned even if the market is closed.
The revived bunnies must be placed in The Bunny Circle.

rules.title: Bunny's Eleven
rules.text: The winnings from Carrot Top Royale may be stolen using Bunny's Eleven.

rules.title: P-Cards
rules.text: P-Cards may be used twice by a player (with the matching color Pawn) in the same turn, or during two different turns. After a P-Card has been used, place the colored Pawn on top of the card to indicate that it has been used once. After a P-Card has been used twice, discard the card (but save the Pawn, of course).

After a P-Card has been used, place the colored Pawn on top of the card to indicate that it has been used once. After a P-Card has been used twice, discard the card (but save the Pawn, of course).

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Allows a player to receive any two Pawns from Weil's Pawn Sho (if available).

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: Free Pawn may not be used if Weil's Pawn Shop is closed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to purchase any items at Weil's Pawn Shop for 1/2 price.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: If the total price of an item or items requires a Half Dolla and no Half Dolla is available, then the player must round up to the nearest Dolla.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Allows a player to choose any number (1-12) and roll the dice. The number of correct rolls is the number of bunnies a player receives back from the dead (the discard pile).

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: The revived bunnies are placed in The Bunny Circle immediately.

rules.title: P-Cards
rules.text: P-Cards may be used twice by a player (with the matching color Pawn) in the same turn, or during two different turns. After a P-Card has been used, place the colored Pawn on top of the card to indicate that it has been used once. After a P-Card has been used twice, discard the card (but save the Pawn, of course).

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text:
(12-11-10) = Receive 3, 2 or 1 Carrot(s) from Kaballa.
(09-07) = Take 2 Cabbage & 3 Water Cards.
(06-04) = Feed your bunny 5 Cabbage & 5 Water immediately!
03 = A bag of sugar is dropped killing your bunny!
02 = A pitchfork kills your bunny & adjacent bunnies!
01 = Disaster! Lose all of your bunnies and Carrots!

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: If the consequence for a bunny is to feed, then it must be done immediately. An opponent with no saved Cabbage Units or saved Water Units will not have the opportunity to buy supplies from Kaballa's Market since it will not be his turn. Cabbage Cards, Water Cards, and Carrots are taken from Kaballa's Market (if the market is open).

rules.title: P-Cards
rules.text: P-Cards may be used twice by a player (with the matching color Pawn) in the same turn, or during two different turns. After a P-Card has been used, place the colored Pawn on top of the card to indicate that it has been used once. After a P-Card has been used twice, discard the card (but save the Pawn, of course).

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text:
Lowest roll is the supply received by the player:
  • Green - 2 Cabbage Cards
  • Blue - 2 Water Cards
  • Orange - 2 Carrot Cards
  • Yellow - 20 Dolla
  • Violet - 2 Bunnies
  • Black - 2 Defense Cards
  • Red - 2 Pawns
  • Clear - All of the items listed

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: Cabbage Cards, Water Cards, and Carrots are taken from Kaballa's Market (if the market is open), Dolla and bunnies are taken from the Discard Pile if they are available, Defense Cards are taken from Rooney's Weapons Emporium (if the emporium is open) and Pawns are taken from Weil's Pawn Shop (if the shop is open).

rules.title: P-Cards
rules.text: P-Cards may be used twice by a player (with the matching color Pawn) in the same turn, or during two different turns. After a P-Card has been used, place the colored Pawn on top of the card to indicate that it has been used once. After a P-Card has been used twice, discard the card (but save the Pawn, of course).

  • Red - 2 Pawns
  • Clear - All of the items listed

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to feed any (or all) bunnies in the Bunny Circle any amounts of Cabbage and Water.

rules.title: P-Cards
rules.text: P-Cards may be used twice by a player (with the matching color Pawn) in the same turn, or during two different turns. After a P-Card has been used, place the colored Pawn on top of the card to indicate that it has been used once. After a P-Card has been used twice, discard the card (but save the Pawn, of course).

After a P-Card has been used, place the colored Pawn on top of the card to indicate that it has been used once. After a P-Card has been used twice, discard the card (but save the Pawn, of course).

title: Bunny On The Edge Of Forever

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to force the current player to replay his turn. Essentially a "Do-Over". May be used at any time!

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: All cards played during the turn are returned to their starting positions at the beginning of the turn in the same order as they were before the turn began (except for the Bunny On The Edge Of Forever card, which is placed in the Discard Pile). The cards may need to be returned to the Draw Pile, Discard Pile or player's five-card hands. The current player's turn starts again. Play may very well continue exactly as it did the first time, unless a player changes his mind about an important decision, or unless a die rolls differently than it did before.

rules.title: Tachyon Turnaround
rules.text: Tachyon Turnaround may be used to counteract Bunny On The Edge Of Forever.

rules.title: Nothing Is Forever
rules.text: Nothing Is Forever may be used to eliminate this card.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to counteract any Very Special card. If the current date is an Equinox or Solstice day, then the player is allowed to keep and use the opponent's card again. May be used at any time!

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text:
If players have access to current and accurate astrological data for the year in which they are playing the game then, by all means, use that data to determine the precise Equinox and Solstice dates. If not, then simply use these approximate dates:
  • Spring Equinox: March 20th
  • Summer Solstice: June 21st
  • Autumn Equinox: September 22nd
  • Winter Solstice: December 21st

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to counteract Weil's Freshness Center by keeping all his Carrots fresh (and tasty). May be used at any time!

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: One of your bunnies (suffering from acute myopia) jumps into a pool before checking the water level!

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: If a player draws a PLAY IMMEDIATELY card but has no bunny in The Bunny Circle, then he must place the card on an opponent's bunny in The Bunny Circle causing it to die (discarded). This is also true if the player's only bunny in The Bunny Circle is protected by The Heavenly Halo or Angel Wings

rules.title: Mysterious Place
rules.text: The player who currently holds the Yellow Ball can control the destiny of this card. The opponent must play the card first, then the player holding the Yellow Ball may redirect it to any other player, bunny or the Discard Pile.

rules.title: Protection
rules.text: The Heavenly Halo and Angel Wings will protect a bunny from any terrible misfortune. The Guardian Angle can be used to eliminate a Terrible Misfortune.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: When the player draws the Random Dolla card, he must roll the Clear 20-sided die immediately and spend the amount of Dolla rolled at any open store. Random Dolla may not be saved. If no stores are open, then the player is out of luck.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text:
Starting prices for supplies:
5 Dolla - for each Pawn
10 Dolla - for each Bunny
(Bunnies must be Run through)
